intro: Maytenus pseudoboaria var. monantha, commonly known as the monantha mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often greenish-white in color. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and growth habit compared to other varieties of Maytenus.
